boardgame.name: The Goat Mayor
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You visit the peculiar village of Basht expecting a pleasant evening filled with good food and drink, and a chance to learn their strange customs and superstitions. Your evening is interrupted when you are asked to rescue their mayor. Their mayor? A goat that lives in the center of town. Why is he so vital, and why is this a job for adventurers?

A Two to Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 1 Characters.

Optimized for APL 3.

The Goat Mayor originally debuted at U-Con on November 2019.

boardgame.name: Rescue Down Under
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

While in the peculiar village of Basht, a town full of strange customs and superstitions, an elderly woman asks you to check in on her grandson, a Gondite tinkerer testing out his latest invention in a nearby cavern. Sounds easy enough, right?

A Two-Four Hour Adventure for 5th-10th Level Characters

This adventure originally debuted as custom content for the 2019 U-Con convention in Ann Arbor, Michigan.

boardgame.name: A Simple Plan
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Part Three of the Immortals Adventurer's League Series

Following leads from their previous adventures, the characters explore the Salazane mansion and confront the source of the ancient family curse.

Though the Witch King has been defeated, remnants of his ancient evils linger on.

boardgame.name: To Give and to Take
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The children of Elmswood’s favorites bard has gone missing, and with them a sense of charitable behavior. He’s got to be around somewhere, hasn’t he? Goblins wouldn’t have anything to do with it.

No?

boardgame.name: Páros Játszma
boardgame.description:
Páros Játszma is a board game that raises serious and funny questions between couples living and in love together that they think they know about each other.
The board game reveals whether we know each other well.

Sure, it raises conflicts in several cases, but that makes it an interesting game.
Dormant desires, dreams, or even annoying little things can come up. Get to know yourself wisely!

Couple vs couple game mode:
This board game is actually a dating quiz where it can even turn out that friends know the couple better than they know each other.
Going through the fields of the board, you will encounter many good-natured, provocative, or surprising questions, if you know your partner’s answer in advance because you know him/her well, you can move quickly to victory!

boardgame.name: The Enemy of Greed
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A group of bandits hides in the Quivering Forest and ambushes travelers to Phlan. The Emerald Enclave wants them dealt with. Will you assist?

A two hour adventure for tier one characters, optimized for APL 2.

boardgame.name: Adventuring Fates
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A rescue attempt of kidnapped villagers in a nearby cave system went awry. Sister Claire is trying to gather a band of adventurers for another attempt. Can they free the captured and stop the menace to the village?

A two hour adventure for T1 characters, optimized for APL 3.

boardgame.name: A Negotiated Heist
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

An object for locating a threat to Maladomini has been discovered and must be acquired.

A four hour adventure for tier three characters, APL 13.

boardgame.name: The Lakebed Archive
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Deep within the Moonsea, a vault of ancient knowledge exists beneath the murky waters. However, the knowledge must now be reclaimed...

A two hour adventure optimized for tier 1 characters, APL 3.

boardgame.name: A Colossal Mess
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A massive ice statue is rampaging through the city of Tantlin in Stygia. Can it be stopped, and who set it loose?

A two hour adventure for T2 characters. APL 7.

boardgame.name: Digging for Trouble
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Mahadi wants his money back, and the only thing to do is to go Digging for Trouble.

A two hour adventure for T2 characters. optimized for APL 8.

boardgame.name: The Mournful Golem
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Strange lights and harsh whispers in the graveyards near Scyulla’s Watch have come along with a series of grave robberies which mirror those committed years ago. The party is hired to investigate and finds that they aren’t grave robberies, but something much stranger.

A Two -Hour Adventure for Tier 1 Characters. Optimized for APL 3.

boardgame.name: Warpstar!
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Warpstar! is a rule-light science fiction roleplaying game set within the Chorus of a million worlds that aims to emulate the feeling of old-school British tabletop games of adventure and action in the depths of space.

Warpstar! looks to reproduce the themes and feeling of its illustrious predecessors but in a light, quick and simple manner, with a consistent rules set that is easily hackable and adaptable as desired.

boardgame.name: The Terminator RPG Quick Start
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

LOS ANGELES 2029 A.D.

The machines rose from the ashes of the nuclear fire. Their war to exterminate mankind has raged for decades, but the final battle would not be fought in the future.

It would be fought here, in our present.

TONIGHT...
...
This game is licensed from STUDIOCANAL and includes The Terminator movie and its associated Dark Horse comics.

boardgame.name: Vindication: Villages & Hamlets
boardgame.description:
The island of ruins and resurgent magic still holds many secrets. Packed with new map regions and cards to explore and leverage, this module set also introduces new ways to discover, control, and interact with every location as well as methods to include more tile options in each game. Want more; have more. It's your journey.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Vindication

boardgame.name: Lady Eileen's Castle
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

MASSCONFUSION 1984 AD&D Open Competition
...
Lady Eileen's ancestral castle has been taken over by Baron Rodak and his band of mercenary thugs. Rodak and several retainers entered the castle under the guise of friendship while Lady Eileen and her maids were visiting relatives. By a surprise raid, Rodak and his men slauightered the guards, threw open the gates and achieved possession.

boardgame.name: Dale of Merchants: Playmat
boardgame.description: Playmat for one player. There are designated spots for stall, deck, and discard pile with additional space for cards in your schedule and a character card. The mat is sized at 35 x 25 cm (roughly 14 x 10 inches).

boardgame.name: Dale of Merchants: Playmat bag
boardgame.description:
A bag made from sturdy canvas fabric with custom Dale of Merchants printing. Holds up 4 playmats for easy storage and transport. Includes a string to hold the bag close and a carabiner clip for hanging.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Dale of Merchants 3: The Grand Continental Railway
Dale of Merchants: Systematic Eurasian Beavers

boardgame.name: Lost Cities: Roll & Write
boardgame.description:
In Lost Cities: Roll & Write, you want to start your expeditions on the six colored paths with the smallest possible numbers on the dice. Each turn, decide whether to continue with an expedition or start a new one. Acceleration fields and artifacts provide opportunities to advance quickly, but you'll have to carefully consider which paths to take on which roll. If you make good progress, victory beckons — but if an expedition gets stuck, you will lose points just as quickly as you earned them!

In more detail, each player has their own score sheet, which has eight columns on it: six colored columns matching the colors of Lost Cities (red/orange/yellow/green/blue/purple), an artefact column, and a dice column. You will fill or mark all of these columns from the bottom up.

On a turn as the active player, you roll the six dice — three six-sided color dice and three ten-sided dice numbered 0-9 — then choose one number die and one color die, then mark this number in this color column on your sheet. If you choose 0 and haven't started this color column, you can mark the "double point" circle at the bottom of the column. If you choose a non-0 number and haven't started this column, you write the number in the bottommost space of the column; if you have started this column, then you can add another number to this column only if it's the same value or higher. (A 0 is written as 10 in a column.) Other players choose a number die and a color die from the two of each that remain, then mark one of their columns in a similar manner.

If you place a number on an arrow in a column, then you can "accelerate" any color column by filling the bottommost empty space with the same number currently at the top of that column. If you write over another arrow, then you accelerate once again! If you place a number on an artefact box, then you mark off a space in the artefact column. If you've filled all nine spaces in a column and can write a number there once again, you instead mark off an artefact.

If you wish, you can refuse to choose a number-color combination. If you do, then you mark off a die in the dice column.

If you write a number in the seventh box in a color column or mark off the seventh space in the artefact or dice column — and you're the first player to do so — then you score a 20 point "bridge bonus" for being the first player to cross that bridge.

If you mark off the ninth space in the dice column, you are considered to be "exhausted", but you continue to play. The game ends after the turn in which all players are exhausted or all eight bridges have been crossed. Players then score points for each color column based on the number of spaces they've filled, doubling this score — whether positive or negative — if they've marked the "double point" circle at the bottom of the column. Players also score points for the number of spaces marked in the artefact and dice columns, but if you're exhausted, then you score 0 points for that column. Add your bridge bonus points to the sum of these eight columns, and whoever has the highest score wins.

boardgame.name: Cold as Ize
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

SHOTGLASS ROUNDS are 12-page, PDF-only One-Shots for 5e for the DM who doesn’t like to prep! Flexible, convenient, super-charged excitement in a compact package that won’t have you sitting up for hours doing prep for your next game session!

Each adventure is presented in the proven Shotglass Adventures format, designed for a 4-5 hour game. Each PDF includes a two-page spread of the adventure with DM’s map and key (so you can lay it out on the table in front of you and have everything at a glance), 2 new monsters & 2 new magic items, a full-size player’s map with grid & a full-size grid-less player’s map!

boardgame.description:

SHOTGLASS ROUNDS are 12-page, PDF-only One-Shots for 5e for the DM who doesn’t like to prep! Flexible, convenient, super-charged excitement in a compact package that won’t have you sitting up for hours doing prep for your next game session!

boardgame.description:

SHOTGLASS ROUNDS are 12-page, PDF-only One-Shots for 5e for the DM who doesn’t like to prep! Flexible, convenient, super-charged excitement in a compact package that won’t have you sitting up for hours doing prep for your next game session!

boardgame.name: Swords and Super-Science of Xuhlan (Revised)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Swords and Super-Science of Xuhlan is a campaign setting for use with the Warriors of the Red Planet Roleplaying Game.

New character races: Mutant, Robot, Rogue Formian, Rogue Formiankin, Lizard Folk.
Rules for Psychic Combat and Super-Science Research.
Wyrd Stones, mysterious artefacts that let you manipulate the matrix of Matter, Energy, Time and Space.
18 new creatures including Spectral Walkers and Winged Squid.
Seven strange Alien Godlings.
Campaign map with 100 detailed hexes.
The city state of Yankara.
The Vaults of Illumination, a 22 room starting dungeon.

boardgame.name: The Book of Random Tables: Cyberpunk 2
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Do you play Cyberpunk RED, Shadowrun, or another cyberpunk tabletop RPG? Cut down your gamemaster prep time with 32 D100 random tables.

Just like the first book, this book helps the gamemasters of cyberpunk tabletop role-playing games cut down their prep time. These random tables add details to campaigns and sessions with a roll of the dice.

Find useful tables like Items in a Corporation Locker Room, Items in a Gang Hideout, Items in a Pawn Shop, Items in a Slurp, Shop's Kitchen, Office Building Encounters, City Locations and Shops, Names, Brand Names, and more.

boardgame.name: Käpt'n Kuller
boardgame.description:
The pirate gang has collect huge piles of loot, and to distribute the treasures, they've decided to play the legendary pirate skittles game.

Who will manage to make the ball roll skillfully down the launch tube in Käpt'n Kuller to hit the desired diamonds and in the end collect the most gold coins?

listing.notes:
Spieleranzahl: 2 bis 4 Spieldauer: 15 Minuten Altersempfehlung: 5+
Käpt'n Kuller Yo-ho-ho! Eure Piratenbande hat fette Beute gemacht. Wie nach jeder Kaperfahrt heißt es jetzt: Auf die Schätze, fertig, los! Aber wer bekommt welchen Teil der Beute? Kugeln raus und losgespielt! Das traditionsreiche Piraten-Kegeln kann beginnen. Zielt genau, lasst die Kugel durch das Rohr sausen und trefft die richtigen Diamanten, die ihr dann gegen Goldmünzen eintauschen könnt. Das Piraten-Kegeln gewinnt, wer als Erster vier verschiedenfarbige Goldmünzen ergattert hat. Ahoi! - Einfache Regeln - Schneller Spielspaß
Inhalt: 36 Diamanten 24 Goldmünzen 3 Fässer 2 Kugeln 2 Kunststoffchips 1 Rohr 1 Spielanleitung

boardgame.name: Fisheries of Gloucester
boardgame.description:
The fisheries of Gloucester lay at the heart of the 19th century New England fishing industry. The city's ports are filled with rugged individuals prepared for the difficult tasks ahead. Gather the crew, board the schooners, cast your nets, and catch loads of fish as you sail toward victory.

The two-player game Fisheries of Gloucester lasts six "days" (rounds). On each day, players have a designated number of hours to spend to perform various actions, such as charting the course, sailing your boats, and catching fish. Each player has a fleet of three boats that can be advanced by first "charting a course" (laying down an ocean tile, which have various polynomial shapes). With courses set, players can move their boats along the course, racing against other boats to find the prime fishing spots.

Players earn points by catching different varieties of fish and by finishing the game on one of the islands in the ocean.

-description from designer
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Fisheries of Gloucester: Fisherman's Feud Pack

boardgame.name: Participation Award
boardgame.description:
"You and the other players must work together to defeat monsters, but you're all a bit lazy and really don't feel like working too hard."

Interesting game in that if the team does well, the players that did the most work earn the least points, but if the team did poorly, then those that pulled more than their weight do get the most points.

The game plays in rounds until the target score is reached; this is calculated based on the number of players. Each player gets 4 dice per player contributing one to the monster pool in the center. Roll the monster dice and that is what you the total you need to beat the monster. Roll your 3 remaining dice and secretly choose some number of those to defeat the monster.

Then you will score based on success or failure relative to where you fall your the contribution. Once one player gets to the target the game ends with the highest score the winner.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Random Fun Generator (Steve Jackson Games)

boardgame.name: Ничего человеческого Мини
boardgame.description:
The year is 2025, and it's been a long time since the robots have taken over the Earth. Now it's time to pass the final test to prove that you have nothing but oil in your veins and no trace of humanity left, and there's no better way to do this than to demonstrate your perfect memory!

Your goal in Are You a Human? is to guess the three characteristics of the cards. Guess card features and score points in a way that boosts player interaction, forces you to assess the risks, and makes everyone involved in the exciting process. Pass the captcha of the nasty robots!

Contain 48 Memory cards and 3 Short Circuit cards instead of 64 and 6 cards in standard version.

boardgame.name: Liquid Courage
boardgame.description:
"You and the other players are Dwarves. After centuries of peace, Dragons now threaten your way of life. Tunnel into long forgotten mines to find the tools to help you survive the onslaught. With Dwarven beer to bolster your courage, only the bravest Dwarves will be celebrated as legendary heroes!"

This game is played in rounds and you want to gain 6s per round to score points, but you need to be able to get those and 1s to keep rolling. Keep pushing your luck trying not to bust to improve your score.

When someone breaks 50 points or higher at the end of a round the game ends and the highest score wins.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator

boardgame.name: Think Fast!: Disney Edition
boardgame.description:
Put your Disney knowledge to the ultimate test in this Think Fast party game from Ridley's Games where you know all the answers! In this Disney edition of our popular, fast-paced trivia game Think Fast!, teams go head-to-head in 3 rounds. With each round the answers stay the same, but the questions get harder, until you're only given one word! You have 30 seconds to answer in, so you need to Think Fast if you want to win! Get your Disney and Pixar facts at the ready to solve questions on Princesses, Villains, Sidekicks and so much more!

Includes 240 question cards, score pad, sand timer, pencil and instructions.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Duello
boardgame.description:
"In this tense game of give and take, you must know when to attack and when to guard. Boost your own score or steal from your opponent? Only one you is left standing in the end!"

This is a game of taking turns swapping locked dice to try and achieve the highest sum. It's actually clever in that it uses both a single die and your opponent's rolled dice as potential locking mechanisms.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Random Fun Generator (Steve Jackson Games)

boardgame.name: Pluszowe Opowieści: Zagubiona opowieść #1
Stuffed Fables: Lost Story #1
boardgame.description:
This lost story is a stand-alone adventure for Stuffed Fables that can be inserted between chapters 3 and 4 if players are enjoying Stuffed Fables as a campaign. This exciting story sees the Stuffies battling on the streets of their town with the dreaded Dollmaker and his newest contraption!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Cavern of the Sub-Train
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Cavern of the Sub-Train is a scenario set in the Gamma Terra gaming environment. This module has been adapted to my Masters of the Earth Campaign from the original written by Gary "Jake" Jaquet. I have attempted to keep the original text whenever possible except where it was required to match my specific campaign requirements.

It has been designed for use by 3-8 players of levels 3-6, being optimal.

The adventure begins in the ruins of Lorns North East of the city state of Boze. Life in the city state has been rather uneventful, other than the usual dangers of the environment. Recently, however, a most unusual discovery has been made, one which will shortly send player characters on an exciting and dangerous adventure.

boardgame.name: Masters of the Earth
boardgame.description:
User summary:

The Masters of the Earth game is a heavily customized implementation of d20 Modern System intended to support campaign play in the "Masters of the Earth" setting, itself a customized implementation of Gamma Terra.

The Masters of the Earth game has a long development history. The campaign setting ante-dates the game system, and originally was used with Gamma World. The current version of the game is available for free download.

The game is published as a series of 38 PDF documents organized by topic. Each document has a separate revision history and publication date. The game's primary development occurred 2003 - 2005.

boardgame.name: Puzzle Panic
boardgame.description:
A whopping word whizz? Marvellous at maths? Love your letters? Ridiculously good at riddles? Then it’s your chance to shine as you battle it out to find the speediest puzzler!

The rules are simple. Everyone races to solve each puzzle and the first player to crack it and ding the bell wins the round!

Will you be super quick or will you panic under the pressure?

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Dwarven Hall Construction
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

An addition for Save vs. Cave: Dwarven Rooms & Halls to let you construct your own larger rooms. Construct your own dwarven great halls from various pieces. Goes great with my other dwarven Sets. Intend for use with virtual tabletops.

boardgame.name: Cursed Lair
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Seven large (30x30) and Eight small (15x15) magically inscribed maps in two color variations.

Use them on their own of fit them together to form a sprawling evil lair.

boardgame.name: Necropolis Great Vaults
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

4 Extra Large Multi Section Tomb Maps

Need some extra room to stretch your vast moldering wings of night? Rooms with leg room for the dead is what we got here. Goes great with my first necropolis.

Intended for virtual table tops.

boardgame.name: Winter Hall 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

9 Modular Sections of Frozen Fort

Not enough winter in your great hall? Add some more endless frozen stone lair to your first winter hall maps. Buy them both and that’s a real winter's haul! (apologies) Goes great with my Save vs. Cave sets.

Intended for use with virtual table tops.

boardgame.name: Trenches
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Various pieces to construct your trench maps for historical or grim-dark future warfare

Need to perish slowly from sitting in a dirty ditch for endless months of fighting? Have I got the place for you! Build various types of trenches from an assortment of parts. Intended for use with virtual table tops.

boardgame.name: Necropolis Mapper
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Various pieces to construct your own city of the dead.

Want your adventurers to visit a city full of people they can’t kill? Try a city where everyone is already dead! Be warned though dead folks are not good with property maintenance. They don’t tend to get up and walk around, and If they start too that tends to be even worse. Goes great with my modular necropolis. Intended for use with virtual tabletops.

boardgame.name: Graveyards
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Various pieces to construct your own graveyards and cemeteries

Need to make your own graveyard for all the folks your party has killed? I got your back. Goes great with my "Vile tiles: Cinematic Gore" sets. Intended for use with virtual table tops.

boardgame.name: Graveyards Addition
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Various pieces to add to Vile Tiles: Graveyards

Hate using the same piece twice when constructing your graveyards? This set adds even more variations to choose from. Intended for use with virtual table tops.

boardgame.name: Pumpkin Patches
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

8 30x30 Pumpkin filled maps in two variations forest and rocky field

Have the worshipers of the squash king gone too far again this year and planted the seeds of the downfall of man throughout the forest? Zanny! Goes great with other Critical Trail sets. Intended for use with virtual table tops.

boardgame.name: Winter Forest 1
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

9 Modular Sections of Winter Forest

Bored of wolves hunting you through the deep green woods that don’t know the tread of mortal man? Trying being hunted through stark winter forest by white wolves as the snow grows thick around your knees instead. It's an exciting change of pace!

Intended for use with virtual table tops.

boardgame.name: Winter Druid Shrines
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

8 Modular Sections of Winter Forest Shrines

Druids, always worshiping the murderous winter’s forest, those scamps. Why not let your party fall into their primal talons today?

Intended for use with virtual table tops.

boardgame.name: Winter Forest Foothills
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

9 Modular Sections of Winter Forest

Demand your money back, none of these hills are shaped anything like a foot! Goes great with my other winter forest sets.

Intended for use with virtual table tops.

boardgame.name: Gargantaun Skeletons
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

8 modular hell maps in two color variations.

Need some skeletons that weigh hella tons or is your party under the effects of that shrinking curse again? Either way you can tip toe through the tibias with this pack. Goes great with other Hell in a handbasket sets.

Intended for use with virtual table tops.

boardgame.name: Ship Pack 4
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Unfurnished Maps for 4 Multi-deck Ships

Unfurnished deck plans for 4 fantasy ships plus token for each to track movement on larger maps. Maps come with ocean or black backgrounds. They go great with my other ship sets.

Intended for use on virtual tabletops.

boardgame.name: Dark City 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

4 Multi-story 30x30 sections of Dark Tower filled city

This city is diabolically complex, which makes complete sense as it was made by demons. In two variants: Moist or well done with furnished and unfurnished versions of each. Goes great with my other spire city sets.

Intended for virtual table tops.

boardgame.name: Dark City 3
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

4 Multi-story 30x30 sections of Dark Tower filled city

Spire city 3, because presumably both 1 and 2 sank into the water and/or lava. That or you are constructing a big city from the parts of all three. Probably the later come to think of it. Which is why it goes great with my other spire city sets.

Intended for virtual table tops.

boardgame.name: Strange Encounters: Lair of the Wampusnasty (Troika)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Strange Encounters:
Lair of the Wampusnasty

A zine for Troika!

Strange encounters are one off little side trips. Sometimes they’re fun, sometimes they’re nasty, and sometimes they are just weird. This one is kinda weird. This is not an adventure, just a place and critters.

boardgame.name: Sommerset Village
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The roadway meanders through the forest of red before reaching a wide river which it then follows till you reach the village of Sommerset. Great trees reach towards the heavens from their cliff side perch, while the river falls down towards the low lands beyond.

A bridge has been formed of roots and living branches that leads into the small village where a tavern and some small houses are. Ramps also formed of these living roots take you up to many walkways where shrines have been carved into the trees.

Adventure Seed

Scouts have returned to the village with foreboding news. During their last patrol along the forest road they came across a ravaged elven merchant’s cart, two bodies where found, one wearing fine silken clothes and the other studded leather. In each of their bodies the scouts found several crude arrows, perhaps even poisoned. Any jewelry they were wearing must have been taken as well as any edible goods the merchant may have been carrying on the cart, including all of the bottles of a highly addictive red liquid that didn’t get smashed.

Strangely enough however, many of the other goods were not taken, high quality silks and wooden carvings all remained by the cart. This has been an escalation in attacks made against the village of sommerset by what the guard believe to be a warren of goblins. The mayor stands resolute in the belief these dirty creatures would never attack the village but the village guard captain isn’t so sure. He’s enlisted your help to track down the warren and hopefully end them before they become more of an issue.

If you choose to go after the warren, you find it in a small cavern in the cliff side some miles away from the village. Multiple goblin bodies are lifeless on the floor and only one living goblin seem to be nuzzling at a glass bottle which contains a red liquid, it’s eyes completely bloodshot. When spotted you are attacked, while the goblin yells about you not taking it’s precious.

After dispatching this goblin, it dawns on you there are not nearly enough goblins here to have been causing so many problems for sommerset, so you set off toward the village. When you arrive it’s already to late, the village has come under attack by the rest of the warren of goblins and they’re flooding the streets and hunting through the homes of the elves.

What’s going on? After the goblins ambushed the last elven caravan they came across one of the elves favorite but highly addictive drinks, a red liquid that normally create a feeling of complete serenity. However due to differences in biology this drink seems to have make the goblins extra aggressive and in combination with it’s addictive properties caused them to turn on each other until it was all gone and the only place to get more was the elven town itself.

boardgame.name: Cursed Shores High Tide
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

After traversing the sea side for some time, all seems normal but you feel a dense of dread in the air. You soon after come across the debris of ships who have come to close to the shore, driven to seek out the beautiful music of the sirens who make this place their home.

One ship has been completely flipped and become wedged in between two rocky ledges, forming an unnatural bridge. Parts of it’s hull have fallen away giving a direct path through the ship and to the other side for creatures swimming beneath the waves.

An even older ship sits stranded up on a cliff ledge, a wooden angel serving as it’s masthead as well as multiple sandy paths which lead up deep inland.

boardgame.name: Beach Rock Pools
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

After traversing the beach side for some time, you come across rock pools where crabs attempt to catch fish that have become trapped by the tides. Rocky ledges shadow over the trickling streams of water that seek to reunite with the ocean. Multiple sandy paths lead up into the forested hills and further inland into the thick forest.

boardgame.name: Sprites Forest Canyon
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

After traversing the forested hills of the sprites for some time, you come across a series of natural springs which have filled up the lower ground with streams of pristine water. Rocky ledges shadow over the trickling streams of water and multiple grasses paths lead up into the forested hills and further into the thick forest.

boardgame.name: Canyon Oasis
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

After traversing the desolate hills for some time, you come across a series of large canyons cutting through the land forcing you to travel down into their depths or a long trek around. Rocky ledges shadow over sandy floors hiding creatures that wish to avoid the suns glare and drink from a solemn and rare oasis that has formed here. Multiple sandy paths lead up the cliff side and on to your destination from the oasis.

boardgame.name: Desert Canyon
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

After traversing the desolate hills for some time, you come across a series of large canyons cutting through the land forcing you to travel down into their depths or a long trek around. Rocky ledges shadow over sandy floors hiding creatures that wish to avoid the suns glare. Multiple sandy paths lead up the cliff side and on to your destination.

boardgame.name: The Blood Shores
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

After traversing the bloodied beach side for some time, you come across debris of ancient ships who came to close to the shore. One ship has been completely flipped and become wedged in between two rocky ledges, forming an unnatural bridge. Parts of it’s hull have fallen away giving a direct path through the ship and to the other side.

From here an even older ship sits stranded up on a cliff ledge, a wooden angel serving as it’s masthead as well as multiple sandy paths which lead up deep inland.

boardgame.name: Arcanis 5E Sorcerous Pacts
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

An Incredible Journey...

In the days after the fall of the Eloran Empire, Telas, a Kelekene sorcerer, begins a quest to find the lost gods of the elorii. During his journey, he’ll visit strange and exotic other-planar Realms, entreat with bizarre entities, and forge bargains granting deadly allies and devastating powers.
boardgame.rpgsetting: Arcanis: The World of Shattered Empires

boardgame.name: An Unofficial Pokémon Dungeon Crawler
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is an unofficial Pokémon dungeon crawler. You play as a Pokémon in a world after humans. You get a dungeon delving class (cleric, fighter, magic-user), you get a backpack, a weapon, and you head out on an adventure.

This game plays similar to OSR-style games with a d20, roll-under system. Most rolls are player-facing; Players roll to attack and to dodge while the Game Master uses dice to keep track of the various complexities of dungeon crawling.

As of now there are 20 playable Pokémon and 3 classes. Expansions can be made if the demand is high. The pdf is 62 pages and comes with a dungeon to start your adventure.

boardgame.name: Matador
Matador De Luxe
boardgame.description:
The first edition of Monopoly published in Iceland, prior to 1964, named Matador.

Streets of the game are located in downtown Reykjavík, and companies include Loftleiðir and Flugfélag Íslands.

Along with the usual Monopoly items, it features a circular track.
boardgame.boardgameversion: Drechsler Danish Fifth Edition De Luxe

boardgame.name: Cum Face Game
boardgame.description:
This hilarious duel pump action penis game is like nothing else you’ve seen and the perfect party piece for bachelor and bachelorette parties and other fun-filled events.

How to play… Before you begin, pour liquid into the hole positioned between the two shafts. We advise water but any safe to consume liquid can also be used.

The object of the game is to pump the penises as quickly as possible to be the first player to squirt their opponent in the face, or mouth, and be declared the fastest w@*ker. Then, pass it on to the next contenders.

Fill it up and start pumping, be quick though, or you’ll get a face full. Let the games begin.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Vampire Hunter: The Card Game
boardgame.description:
Vampire Hunter is a single deck card game where players try to become the best Vampire Hunter by killing undead blood suckers and collecting their fangs. The first player to collect fifteen fangs is the winner. That said a player can also win by being the last player left. This is a game for two to four players.

On their turn, a player must take one of three actions. Either visiting the city to equip themselves with weapons and other items, attacking one of the colorful yet horrifying enemies lurking within the city, or using and equipped item. If you are unable to take any action, you must discard one of your precious items card and take a damage.

Variable deck set-up and character selection (each with a unique ability) means no two games will play exactly the same.

boardgame.name: The Goblin Grinder
boardgame.description:
Introduction'
The streets of Galgenbeck are littered with corpses, twisted, inhuman things: a goblin isn't an attractive thing on a good day - and dead they are truly distasteful. There's also the living goblins - probably the bigger issue here.

boardgame.name: Cat Quest + Cat Quest 2 Pawsome Pack
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Cat Quest and Cat Quest II in a single physical bundle. The furtastic Pawsome Pack come with the single-player action RPG of the original game and the one- or two-player second installment.

boardgame.name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar Soulbound Gamemaster's Screen
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Soulbound Gamemaster's Screen presents a helpful summary of the most important rules for playing Soulbound. With stunning artwork created by renowned Warhammer artist Johan Grenier on one side, and tables, charts, and quick references on the other, the Gamemaster Screen is the perfect accessory for any Soulbound GM. Accompanying the screen is Cities of Flame - a 36 page adventure supplement featuring 25 one-page adventures set across five major Cities of Sigmar.

The Gamemaster's Screen and Cities of Flame includes:
The Gamemaster's Screen: A three-panel landscape screen with everything you need, from difficulty tables, to conditions, to all the actions you can take in combat.
Cities of Flame: 25 one-page adventures set in five major cities in Aqshy - Anvilgard, Brightspear, Hallowheart, Hammerhal, and Tempest's Eye
Advice on growing the adventures from whispered rumours to threats that can overcome a city.
Four new enemies to face, including the malevolent Necromancer and their Zombie horde.

boardgame.name: Creature Comforts: Kickstarter Edition
Dobry rok: wersja deluxe
boardgame.description:
Creature Comforts: Kickstarter Edition includes the following items not included in retail version of this game:
- Talents mini expansion
- Dreams Come True mini expansion
- Game Trayz storage solution

Life in the forest is a lot of fun, at least while the sun is shining and the leaves are on the trees. Those days don’t last forever though, and long before the weather starts to change, the wise animals start to harvest for the long cold winter ahead. You will spend many months tucked into your burrow and you want to make it as cozy as possible. A nice bowl of soup, a comfortable rocking chair, and some toys and games will go a long way to make those dark winter days pass by quickly.

In Creature Comforts, you spend the Spring, Summer, and Fall gathering different goods from the forest and spending them to collect items that will make your home more inviting while the world outside is covered in a layer of snow. Each round you send family members out to various locations in an attempt to gain supplies. If they fall short of their goal, they’ll learn a lesson and be better prepared next time. The family that has created the most comfortable den wins the game.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Creature Comforts: Game Table Promo Cards
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: Creature Comforts: Dreams Come True Micro-Expansion

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Une saison au zoo: Le jeu du soigneur
boardgame.description:
Find the animals from your favorite show A Season at the Zoo!
Test your knowledge of Zoo de la Flèche animals and the profession of healer with 1,140 questions.

Draw a map and complete both missions to go from trainee to healer. To do this, join the 2 missions that are assigned to you by answering the various questions accessible to the youngest about the animals of the zoo and about the profession of caretaker.

To have even more fun, several cards are illustrated! It's up to you to guess which animal has been blurred, who owns the coats and fingerprints, or find the solution to the rebus!

boardgame.name: Ten Break
boardgame.description: Ten Break is a card game that simulates a single or doubles tennis match

boardgame.name: Between Two Cities: BGGCon 2015 Promo City Tokens
boardgame.description: The BGGCon 2015 Promo City Tokens (2 per set). Represents Dallas Courthouse (Dallas).

boardgame.name: Battle of the Bismarck Sea
boardgame.description: Battle of the Bismarck Sea is a Pacific Air campaign included with C3i #16 for the Down in Flames game series, specifically the titles Zero! and Corsairs and Hellcats.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Corsairs and Hellcats
Zero!

boardgame.name: Impossible Landscapes
boardgame.description:
From the back cover:

FEAR IS A FRACTAL

…and your world is a lie. A horror freed from an antique book reverberates through reality, shaking things, reordering them and making them run like wax. Doors open to endless Victorian hallways where threats stalk the shadows on clockwork limbs, cold metal seeking the warmth of blood and bone. Madness pursues at every turn, baring its teeth to speak your anme, and you can't escape because it's inside you.

But don't despair. There is hope. A King waits for us. Beyond the tumbledown façade of the world, through the twists and tunnels of the human imagination, past the edge of everything sane, the King of all things waits in the country of Carcosa. The place all madmen go. There, and only there, is the answer to everything.

The last answer.

IMPOSSIBLE LANDSCAPES is the first campaign for DELTA GREEN: THE ROLE-PLAYING GAME. Four operations sprawl across decades and the immeasurable stretches of nightmare. Harrowing investigations and the bitterest truths will test the mettle of the most accomplished Agents.

PLUS:

new entities
new artifacts
new tomes
dozens of new NPCs
rules for running surreal horror
and more

boardgame.name: Weird but True!: The Game
boardgame.description:
Weird but True!: The Game is a trivia game for 2 to 5 players aged 8 years and up. Based on the National Geographic Kids app and book series, players take turns reading wild facts from over 200 questions for everyone to discuss, debate, and decide the correct answer.

Each player gets a chance to answer every question for the chance to move ahead on the spiral game board. Some questions allow for multiple winners; others only allow one winner. The first to the Winner's Circle wins.

There are five categories of questions, including:

Fact & Fiction compares two seemingly unlikely facts for the players to determine which is true.
Brain Blitz is a timed elimination challenge for each player to name items from a given topic without hesitating or repeating one already mentioned.
What's Your Number? seeks for each player to guess as close as possible to an outrageous number included in a fact.

boardgame.name: The Game of Life Pop-O-Matic Trouble Game
boardgame.description:
It's a Game Mashup: The Game of Life and Trouble.

As with the Game of Life game, players move their car token around the board, but in this edition it's not about a career and earning money -- it's about getting car tokens filled with pegs to get them Home first. The Trouble game's Pop-O-Matic die roller is now combined with The Game of Life spinner to create a fun popper-spinner!

boardgame.name: Winzul
boardgame.description:
Start an adventure in the jungle to find Winzul's treasure.
Pick one of eight characters that have landed in a remote island.
You need to find precious stones and use them to enter the chamber of the treasure.
There are multiple dangers on the way, however characters can get stronger.
You can also act against other players and rob them.
You can buy items to aid you in the trip.
If you get all precious stones and open the gates that protect the treasure, Winzul's treasure will be yours.

The objective of the game is to get to the center of the board with enough precious stones to open the threasure.
The board consists of a set of locations (about 70) distributed in the jungle, which are connected to each other by paths.
There are 6 different stones, and which and how many are needed to win, is randomly determined secretly picking up a card at the beginning of the game.
The stones are randomly placed (as face down tokens) in the jungle.
If you find a precious stone, you need to remember where you found it (there are about 70 different locations each with its token!), since you cannot take the token with you (you have a map you can write notes on to remember).
If and when you reach the center of the board, you need to correctly uncover the location of all stones (if you make a mistake, you lose a turn and must reach the center of the board again).
The players throw two dice (movement and gold) which determine the resources they gain and how much they can move in their turn.
The movement is step by step (as part of each move you look what is hidden under the token at the location).
Some tokens contain objects you can pick up to make your character stronger, others, actions, encounters with enemies, events (described in cards you pick up from the events deck),...
You can also collect and place obstacles to make it more difficult for other players to move around the map (i.e., you can place a big boulder, which can be removed if you have a pick axe to free up the path).
In order to take shortcuts (special red paths) you need to fight an enemy (picked up randomly from the enemies deck).
When you fight enemies, you throw three dice whose sum is compared to the enemie's force (to decide if you win or lose the encounter). When you win, you get rewards; if you lose you get a "skull" token.
You can also fight other players if you move to their location, to try and take one of their items.
If at any point you accumulate 4 skulls, you lose the next turn (and start again without skulls).
Whoever is first to reach the center of the board and correctly uncover their target precious stones wins!

boardgame.name: Battleship: Outer Space
boardgame.description:
Battleship: Outer Space is your game of Battleship using three different layers. The game follows basically the same rules as normal Battleship however instead of calling individual spots you will call one of the three sectors (layers) and then a row or column. If any ships are in that row or column you hit all the spots.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Amphibious Fleet
boardgame.description:
Amphibious Fleet is a stand-alone game from Technical Term game company in Japan. It is an addition to Victory Games, "Fleet" series.

Amphibious Fleet is set in the South China Sea. Most scenarios involve China conducting an amphibious invasion of an island in the South China Sea, while the owners of the island attempt to resist China's efforts.

Please note that while the map and counters are marked in English, the rules are in Japanese.

boardgame.name: Killer Party: Bone Appétit
boardgame.description:
Who murdered Celebrity Chef Basturdly? Compete against your friends to solve a culinary crime in Killer Party’s Bone Appétit!

Six to twelve amateur sleuths can play this whodunit party game. To crack the case, collect Clue Cards and use your deductive skills to piece together the events of the crime. But there’s one catch: the only way to get a Clue Card is by performing a crazy stunt! What will you do to get a clue? You and your fellow detectives work your way through three envelopes, until someone solves the case! Sure to get increasingly wacky and hilarious, Killer Party is equal parts fun and challenging! You must use your deductive reasoning and strategic thinking in order to score points and find Chef Basturdly’s killer! At the end of the game, the player with the most points wins! In the event of a tie, you’ll have to take on another mystery – like Killer Party’s Kiss of Death!

Will you be the one to crack the case? Test your sleuthing skills with Killer Party’s Bone Appétit: the social mystery party game!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: A2/AD Fleet
boardgame.description:
A2/AD Fleet is a modern air and sea fighting game from the Technical Term game company in Japan. A2/AD Fleet takes place in the Malacca Strait and the Andaman Islands. The game is an addition to Victory Games' "Fleet" series of games.

A2/AD is a military term for "anti-access/area denial, and A2/AD Fleet does touch on A2/AD tactics. China, India, the United States, Myanmar, Thailand, Malaysia, and Singapore are all represented with ships and aircraft. The action takes place in the Malacca Strait and the Andaman Islands, some of the busiest waterways in the world.

boardgame.name: Allgäu fertig los
boardgame.description: You get in the saddle with a few friends to explore this oasis of the European countryside on your bike. But you want to make it more exciting and decide on a race that will lead you through the Upper, Lower, East and West Allgäu. Everyone gets their own target points, everyone chooses the supposedly shortest route. Actually, everything was really easy if it weren't for the many little adventures and tasks that lurk for you along the way. Only one thing helps: full throttle until „Lälla“ hangs out

boardgame.name: A Tchi?
boardgame.description:
Cooperate or compete with friends in this original card game based on Acadian tradition. See who can best remember their family tree while discovering a unique collection of Acadian names!
The first player draws a card from the stack and flips it over. They state their own name, followed by á (as in catch) and the card name. After this, the next player does the same, starting their own stack.
The challenge is to remember the family tree while only seeing the topmost card.
If a player forgets their family tree, they are out. The last player to remember their ancestors wins!

boardgame.name: The Friendship Game
boardgame.description:
Friends are at the heart of a good life – and what we want when we get together with them is an opportunity to share what is really going on inside us as well as the chance to hear about what has touched, moved or preoccupied them.

This is a game designed to get the very best out of our friendships. Played on a board with a dice and cards, it invites us to ask one another a series of kind but searching questions about our lives. The more honestly and clearly we answer, the faster we advance around the board. The winner of the game is the person who has best demonstrated that bedrock of true friendship: the capacity for sincere, kindly self-disclosure. The game is guaranteed to bring out new facets of our friends and will allow for a series of fascinating moments of revelation and mutual discovery.

The cards cover four categories:

Love
Work
Self
Family


Questions cover topics such as:

Have you ever been secretly a bit attracted to someone you probably shouldn’t have been? (Light)
Have you ever acted on this attraction? (Heavy)
Do you have a strong sense of right and wrong? (Light)
Have you ever violated your own moral code? (Heavy)
Have you ever complained about a colleague’s behaviour? (Light)
Has anyone complained about your own behaviour in the workplace? (Heavy)


—description from the publisher

In The Friendship Game, players score points by giving out information about themselves. Each turn, a player will roll the dice and move their pawn forward. Then, they get a question based on the location they landed on. They can choose to answer the light version of the question, the heavy version of the question, or neither. If they choose to answer the question, the other players will judge if the player has shared fully; if they feel this is the case, the player scores points.

The game ends when a player has reached the end of the track; the player who has scored the most points wins the game.

—user summary

Contains Game Board, 4 Sets of 24 Cards, 6 Wooden Counters, 1 Wooden Dice | 197 x 197 x 35mm | Instructions included | 3 - 6 Players | Suitable for 15 years +

boardgame.name: Leftovers
boardgame.description:
"Compete for points each round, but the player with the lower total for the round gets to keep the leftovers as a bonus. Outwit your opponent and finish with the top score!"

This is a 2 player game...

A set of dice are rolled and put in plain view. Then each player rolls a dice and sets an additional one to match a value of one of the center dice keeping it secret as well.

Repeat play until someone gets 50 or more.

They reveal their dice and then figure out what to remove. This then creates a set of left overs.

The set die + the rolled dice for each player are summed and scored based on whether they odd or even they will score differently. Whoever got a lower score so far gets the left over center die.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Random Fun Generator (Steve Jackson Games)

boardgame.name: Blue's Snack Match Game
Blue's Snack Match Jeu
boardgame.description:
MINIATURE REFRIGERATOR WITH BLUE: Press down on Blue to see what snacks are in the fridge. The snacks in the refrigerator will spin, giving you a new combination of snacks with every turn!
NOT YOUR EVERYDAY MATCHING GAME: Players take turns making matches between the refrigerator and their lunchbox. If, on your turn, a snack in your lunchbox matches what’s displayed, place a token on the item!

BASED ON THE SHOW BLUE’S CLUES: Blue is back and more popular than ever. With rules following the unique structure of the show, players learn valuable skills like reasoning and matching.

QUICK START, FUN AND ENGAGING: Open the box and you’ll find everything you need to play, including easy-to-follow instructions.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Howzzat
boardgame.description: Rain or shine choose to play your favorite game of cricket inside the comfort of your very own home Choose your team members, become a captain and lead your team into play Make wise strategic decisions that will change the course of the game every minute and keep your opponent on the defense-always Are you ready for the most important match of your life Play " the game of cricket "

boardgame.name: Unlock!: Timeless Adventures – Arsène Lupin und der große weiße Diamant
boardgame.description:
One of the three adventures found in Unlock!: Timeless Adventures, it was released by itself in German.


A day like any other in the orphanage of Paris. You will go to bed again with a grumbling stomach and hope that one day you will be able to escape this life. But what is this commotion? You have discovered a mysterious letter. A certain Professor Arsène Lupin wants you to find a diamond? You must be in for an exciting adventure ...

In UNLOCK! - Arsène Lupin and the Great White Diamond, a master thief is up to mischief in Paris in 1900: the year of the World's Fair! You'll embark on a fast-paced scavenger hunt throughout Paris to find the Great White Diamond. Go to mysterious places like the catacombs, meet at the Moulin Rouge, climb the Eiffel Tower or visit the Louvre. But be faster than Marcel and his gang!

In live escape rooms, participants are locked in a room and must manage to get out of it within 60 minutes. UNLOCK! lets you experience this cooperative experience at your home gaming table. The adventures are controlled via cards, and a free companion app can provide clues and tell players if they're right.


Ein Tag wie jeder andere im Waisenhaus von Paris. Ihr werdet wieder mit einem grummelnden Magen ins Bett gehen und hoffen, dass ihr eines Tages diesem Leben entkommen könnt. Doch was ist das für ein Tumult? Ihr habt einen mysteriösen Brief entdeckt. Ein gewisser Professor Arsène Lupin möchte, dass ihr einen Diamanten findet? Da steht euch wohl ein spannendes Abenteuer bevor ...In UNLOCK! - Arsène Lupin und der große weiße Diamant treibt ein Meisterdiebt sein Unwesen im Paris des Jahres 1900: Das Jahr der Weltausstellung!Ihr begebt euch auf eine rasante Schnitzeljagd durch ganz Paris, um den großen weißen Diamanten wiederzufinden. Begebt euch an geheimnisvolle Orte wie die Katakomben, trefft euch am Moulin Rouge, steigt den Eiffelturm hinauf oder besucht den Louvre. Aber seid dabei schneller als Marcel und seine Bande!

In Live-Escape-Rooms werden die Teilnehmer in einen Raum eingeschlossen und müssen es innerhalb von 60 Minuten schaffen, diesen wieder zu verlassen. UNLOCK! lässt euch dieses kooperative Erlebnis am heimischen Spieltisch erleben. Die Abenteuer werden über Karten gesteuert und eine kostenlose Begleit-App kann Hinweise geben und verrät den Spielern, ob sie richtig liegen.

listing.notes: In it's original packaging

German Space Cowboys version.
Box shows little wear. Inside everything there in great condition. Game has been played once without destroying/damaging anything. Ready to be played again.

boardgame.name: Christmas Rush
boardgame.description:
Christmas RUSH is an elimination game and played like the popular card game Spoons.

Game cards are quickly passed between players as the iconic sounds of the holiday season echo in the air. "Merry Christmas," "Jingle Bells," or "Bah, humbug," fellow players might say but don't get too distracted by all the ruckus and fray. Your goal is to collect a set of four identical cards and beat the Christmas RUSH for a game token or else you are out of the game!

The Twist...
Six special action cards add even more excitement to this fast-paced game! Say the phrase printed on these cards when passing them to other players or sing a couple of words from your favorite Christmas carol as you pass the Sing card.

Contents: 62 game cards, 7 Christmas game tokens, and game rules.

-description from publisher's website

boardgame.name: Purple Meeple Eater
boardgame.description:
"You and the other players are all giant, radioactive monsters, smashing your way through the city, munching on local residents. Which of you is going to be the biggest, baddest monster of them all?"

Roll and score each round. You score high or low dice based on whether you get rolled a 1 or not. If your dice are all 1s, you bust scoring 0 for this turn.

You then decide whether to stop and score OR continue and roll the remaining dice. Play rounds like this until someone gets 50 or more points.

-description from the book, Random Fun Generator
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Random Fun Generator (Steve Jackson Games)

boardgame.name: Twilight Struggle: Blame Canada Promo Card
boardgame.description:
Tribute card created by Jason Matthews in response to South Park featuring Twilight Struggle in an episode (season 23, episode 07, hence this is card #2307!)

If the US Controls Canada, remove 2 influence and smack nearest Canadian.
Remove from play if used as an event.

Included with C3i magazine issue 33
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Twilight Struggle

boardgame.name: Dungeon Dash!: A Hero Kids Dungeon Crawl Card Game
boardgame.description:
Dungeon Dash! is a push-your-luck card game set in the world of the Hero Kids Fantasy Role-Playing Game. Each turn you can venture further into the dungeon in search of gold and magic items. Be careful, though, because traps and fierce monsters are in these dark tunnels too!

The print-and-play version of the game comes with rules, 77 dungeon cards, 12 character cards (with color art from the Hero Kids game) and 8 magic item cards. You’ll need to supply some six-sided dice and about 10-15 chips per player.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The American Experiment
boardgame.description:
The Thirteen Colonies have gone from a restless bunch to a group of independent entities. Throughout the process, a number of documents and other writings have played an integral role in motivating the citizenry and justifying the need for Independence. As a publisher, your goal is collect and publish more parts of these documents than your competitors. Publish a significant portion of a document or series of writings and you will attract Advocates that will boost your score. But beware, there is a heavy price for beginning a collection and under-delivering. Or, will you take the ultimate risk and publish only Loyalist writings?

The object of the game is to gain points by playing cards to different collections of writings. A card played to a collection represents one part of a published writing. But, there is a catch - once you begin publishing to a collection your score in that collection starts negative. You must continue publishing to that collection to achieve a positive score in it. Once to have played three cards to a collection you may also play Advocates to the collection which can double, triple, or quadruple your score.

On a player's turn, a card is played either to a collection or to an appropriate discard pile. Then a card is drawn to replace the played card, either from the deck or from the top of one of the discard piles. Cards played to one of the player's collections must be in ascending order, but not necessarily consecutive. Play continues until the draw pile is exhausted at which point the players scores are tallied.

If a player decides to publish the Loyalist writings, they may only play to the Loyalist collection and no other collections, their initial score is doubly negative, and all cards in the Loyalist suit are double valued. It is a high risk, high reward option.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Knights of the Round Table
boardgame.description:
After many years of campaigning, the Knights of the Round Table have returned home. Their greatest desire is to enjoy a round of their favorite game. To their dismay, while they were away marauders destroyed all their copies of the game and it is no longer in print. Out of sheer desperation, the Knights resort to re-implementing the game in their own style as an honor and tribute to the original.

Knights of the Round Table is inspired by King’s Court, the out-of-print cult classic card game issued in 1983 by Janjohn Games, Inc.

This game is a wild re-imagining of UNO with more complex draw cards, wild cards, and other special cards. Some draw cards chain together; others allow you to skip or change the direction to affect different players. Defensive cards allow you to protect yourself or even deflect an action back on the instigator. The goal of each round is to play all of your cards first while the goal of the overall game is to have the lowest score when any one player exceeds 500 points.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Creepy Crawley Castle Game
boardgame.description:
One player is the scantily clad "Victim" trying to escape the horrors of the Creepy-Crawley Castle to reach the "Castle of Safety"... the other players are a Mummy, Werewolf or Vampire trying to catch her! The victim will have a head start but the path to salvation is strewn with both dubiously useful weapons and horrifying setbacks (for victim and villain alike). And that dastardly gargoyle at the end may even decree that EVERYONE loses, dear reader... thus the corpse crumbles.

This is one of five somewhat tongue-in-cheek games from Warren magazines (publishers of Creepy, Eerie, Vampirella and others) that features their rad 70s artwork, creepy critters, sly wit and perilous situations in classic monster chase "spin and move" gameplay.

The Creepy Crawley Castle Game was created by Bill DuBay and appeared in Creepy magazine #55 and Eerie magazine #50 (as inside the magazine cover items, ready to cut out and play), and separately in 1974 as a bundle of "Warren Monster Madness" games by mail order. The bundle included Capture, Monster Match, Creepy-Crawley Castle (aka Creepy Castle), Werewolf! and Monster's Castle.

boardgame.name: Unity: Solo Challenge 1 for Renegade Scout 2nd edition
boardgame.description:
On the quiet mining world of Keshen III, miners and colonial militia have begun defecting and opening fire on loyal security forces. Meanwhile, unidentified military ships are descending from orbit.

Welcome to the first Solo Challenge for the Renegade Scout miniatures rules.

This offers an infantry assault scenario that can be played on your own or with a friend cooperating to "solve" the scenario. You can use any force you like, with the aim being to beat the scenario using the smallest possible points value.


You need 14 infantry figures for the enemy forces. Your own force can be as large or small as you like with 200-250 points (using the Army Builder) being a good starting point.
Mechanics for solo play are included.
3 difficulty toggles are provided to bolster the enemy forces.


The scenario is well suited to help learning the rules, experimenting with different forces and exercising your army building muscles.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Renegade Scout 2: Bleeding Edge Retro Gaming

boardgame.name: The Blighted Well
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Myrrk is a unique Fantasy Adventure gamebook that features isometric illustrations. The Story is set in a chaotic world called Hexwynd in an age of darkness and sorcery.

As the Hero you must venture deep into dungeons, underground sewers, abandoned shrines, wild woodlands, seek out hidden caverns, concealed chambers, and swim deep through underwater tunnels, all in aid of completing your quest.

This first Gamebook in the Myrrk series features 220 paragraph locations as well as story, game rules and the reference and tables section.

Over 50 individual items to collect ranging from weapons, armour, spell scrolls and potions to magical items and rare enchanted artefacts.

Over 20 unique spells to learn and cast including devastating attacks such as ethereal bolt and Frost blast to being able create portals, summon beasts to fight on your behalf, tame wild beasts to the ability to scrye to gain insight on the enemy.

Your Hero can rest, heal, repair damaged and worn items, trade, sell, converse with characters, recruit mercenaries and form alliances to add your adventuring party.

You will face a horde of fearsome Foes, ranging from disease ridden sewer rats, flesh eating leeches, wild beasts, troops of Orcs, blood thirsty mercenaries, tentacled lurkers, terrifying trolls, cunning Evil mages and many more.

Myrrk also includes additional rules so that it can be played as a multiplayer game with or without gaming miniatures.

boardgame.name: The Corsican: Wargaming the Napoleonic Wars
boardgame.description:
MAIN FEATURES
1) Rules developed for different scales, from 28mm to 6mm, at the Regiment level.
2) An original mechanism - using Action Dice - that randomizes the actions that each troop will be able to perform in the turn and gives the commander in chief (the player) the responsibility of distributing these orders with or without privileging certain Troops.
3) An original mechanism - called Action Cards - that, by means of a deck of printable cards, randomizes random events in each turn, granting bonuses and penalties to the armies involved in the combat.
4) An original combat system, which uses randomised dice rolls to determine the outcome, while maintaining a high level of reality in the confrontations between Infantry, Cavalry, and Artillery.
5) Lists with the main Generals, with quality grades for each of them (for use in-game).

WHAT DO I NEED TO PLAY?

Dice - The system uses 6-sided dice (d6)
Measuring tape - Measuring tape is used to determine movement distances, weapon range, etc in centimetres.
Miniatures - Miniatures represent your army. We suggest using miniatures on scales from 6 to 28mm.
Action Cards - We provide a deck of Action Cards that you will need to copy and print.
Scenarios - These are designed to match the real terrain on the battlefields. You can use your own ideas to build scenarios.
Opponents - Invite friends to a fight over the dinner table. You will become generals for a few hours.


—description from the publisher's website

boardgame.name: Werewolf!
boardgame.description:
This is one of five somewhat tongue-in-cheek horror games from Warren magazines (publishers of Creepy, Eerie and Vampirella) featuring campy 70's horror boardgame fun for 2 to 6 players. You will race to determine which house a hungry werewolf is in, who actually died to the fiend, and what the real human identity of the brute is!

Will you play as Red Peepers, Scarlet O'Hare, Pinkie Claw, Cherry Pitts, The Scarlet Crimson (aka Crimson Pimpernel), or Ruby Lisp? Rush to one of 4 creepy houses and make your three dire accusations: "The Werewolf is X player, the victim is X player, and it was done in THIS house!" The other players will consult their cards and if they can disprove one of the accusations must show the card to the accuser.

Much like the classic game Clue, through a process of possibility elimination and logical deduction, a player's accusation will inevitably be correct and they will win the game.

Possibly the best part of the game (or even the only good part?) is the Warren Publishing empire's trippy 70's artwork, featuring a crimson wash of decaying mansions, madly capering denizens and some rather hard to read text. Well, what did you want from a horror magazine publisher anyway? Too bad Vampirella doesn't appear on this one - she's so... toothsome.

The Werewolf! game was created by Bill DuBay and appeared in Creepy magazine issue #57, Eerie #52 (inside the magazine cover to cut out and play), and separately as a bundle of "Warren Monster Madness" games by mail order. The bundle included Capture, Monster Match, Creepy-Crawley Castle (aka Creepy Castle), Werewolf! and Monster's Castle.

boardgame.name: Choose the Path
boardgame.description:
From the Introduction:

WELCOME TO NINJAGO ROLEPLAYING!

You have just discovered a brand new way to have fun in the NINJAGO world! These adventures give you the chance to play as your favourite ninja while solving puzzles and battling foes. So let’s get started!

Are you new to the ways of the ninja? Or do you want to make your own rules and expand your game? Here are a few tips and tricks to help you choose the path. Find ideas for rules and roleplay, character skills and attributes, cool combat and actions, or dive right into four thrilling adventures. From there, your ninja path can take you anywhere. You can play out all or just some of the adventures, or combine your favorite parts and add your own cunning plots and scheming twists to the game. And don’t forget to print the character sheets to give your ninja all the cool skills they need in the Dungeons of Shintaro. Are you ready to roll the dice and Choose The Path?

boardgame.name: King Obould's Fist
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A figure from legend asks the gathered heroes to help set the cosmos aright. Will the heroes overcome the multiversal threat? Will they overcome their own biases?

A four- / six-hour adventure for Tier 3 characters.

Optimized for APL 13.

boardgame.name: The Straw Bears
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You return to the peculiar village of Basht for one of their unusual festivals, the procession of the Straw Bears. You meet some old friends and escort the brave villagers into the woods to meet up with other locals. It should be perfectly safe, shouldn’t it?

A Two to Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 1 Characters.

Optimized for APL 3.

boardgame.name: So, You Get Frogs
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You are certain you went to sleep somewhere quite different, but find yourself awakened in a dismal swamp, on the porch of an empty shack. What forces have drawn you here, and what challenges will you need to survive to get back home?

A Four-Hour Adventure for Tier 1 Characters. Optimized for APL 3.

This fun and unique adventure will allow your players to test their limits and possibly earn bragging rights as they challenge their ability to survive an unending onslaught of foes.

boardgame.name: Escape from the Titanic: Patriot Castaway Expansion
boardgame.description: Escape from the Titanic: Patriot Castaway Expansion allows you to replace the castaways in the Escape from the Titanic base game with patriots of the American Revolution in the role of standard castaways and British Loyalists playing the part of the villain castaways. Otherwise, the rules for the game remain unchanged.

boardgame.name: Stygia: A Refuge In the Cold
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A six hour adventure, set in frozen Stygia the fifth layer of the Nine Hells. It premiered at Save Against Fear in October 2020.

Who would seek safety in the domain of a devil? A desperate eladrin is willing to trade his freedom for a guarantee of safety, even if it’s the bitterly cold ice‐covered oceans of Stygia. But, really, what choice did he have? And what choice will you make?

boardgame.name: In Good Company
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Come, come, all ye daring adventurers - the Young Wolves have a job for you!

It's simple: travel alongside a caravan through the Cormanthor Forest, and escort a sick noblewoman home to her loving family. The job pays handsomely for a week's work.

What could possibly go wrong?

A Thrilling Adventure for Tier 1 Characters. Optimised for APL 3.

boardgame.name: Of Caravans and Crossings
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A wealthy merchant’s child has been abducted by brigands, and courageous adventurers are needed to mount a daring rescue. Will you succeed?

A Two-Hour Adventure for Tier 1 Characters. Optimized for APL 3.

This standalone adventure was designed specifically for play using Theater of the Mind, and debuted at D&D Adventurers League Singapore Community Games Weekend 2020.

boardgame.name: Through the Ashes and Flames
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A relentless heat wave has left the Flooded Forest parched, and the Fireseeker Task Force is scrambling to contain fires that have blazed to inexplicable life. Can you discover what burns at the heart of this mystery before all that is left are ashes?

A Two-Hour Adventure for Tier 1 Characters. Optimized for APL 3.

This standalone adventure was designed specifically for play using Theater of the Mind, and debuted at D&D Adventurers League Singapore Community Games Weekend 2020.

boardgame.name: The Waystop
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A relentless torrential storm has forced you to seek shelter at an abandoned caravan lodge with several others you met on the road, but the dangers outside may pale in comparison to the dangers within. Can you survive the night?

A Tale of Mystery & Suspense for Tier 1 Characters. Optimized for APL 3.

This standalone, roleplay and exploration heavy adventure was designed specifically for play using Theater of the Mind, and debuted at D&D Adventurers League Singapore Community Games Weekend 2020.

boardgame.name: Autumn Waterfall Battle Map (32x24) (Night Version)
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This digital Battle Map comes ready to plug and play into your favorite Virtual Tabletop software (such as Roll20 or Fantasy Grounds) for D&D 5e or Pathfinder tabletop Roleplaying Games (RPGs). It comes with 2K, 4K, and 8K resolution versions. It also includes gridded and non-gridded versions.
